poem:
Title: "Southern Justice"

An orange phoenix in legal parade,
Summoning appeals like acolytes paid.
While Georgia, firm, in her court brings,
A district attorn who on truth clings.
Trump versus Willis, a tangible sphere,
Insidious battle, fervently clear.
Democracy's pace, firm yet ethereal,
Whispers resound in silence mercurial.
Courthouse dimmed, yet its scales displayed,
Judgment - its poetic force, obeyed.
